Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2022027245.CaseDesc: Anne Lenning was last seen in December, 1992, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018029665.CaseDesc:
On May 29, 2018, at approximately 12:40 p.m., Vernon Otto last spoke with his wife
over the telephone, as he was on their property in St. Clements, Manitoba. During the
course of their conversation, Vernon had told his wife that he was going to speak with
a neighbour about vehicle ramps he had lent to him. Vernon had also told her that he
was going to go the Interlake area to look at farm machinery, specifically a crawler.
Vernon's truck was found burnt on May 30th, 2018, at 5:20 pm, a few miles from his
residence.

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2021039122.CaseDesc: In June 1961, Robert Heard was seen for the last time walking in the forest near his farm located on Pot Hole Road in Eby Township, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Robert was experiencing a decline in his mental capacity.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014005384.CaseDesc: Gary Humphrey left his home and employment in Oshawa, Ontario, on 1 April 1989, to visit family in Northern Ireland.  Gary returned to Canada via the Thunder Bay Airport in Ontario.

Case reference: 2022034269.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2022, Malcolm Custer was last seen in the Big Sandy Bay Fishing and Hunting Resort area near Big Sandy Lake, Saskatchewan. Malcolm visits the settlements of La Ronge, Descambault Lake, Brabant Lake, Stanley Mission, and the City of Prince Albert; although he does not have a fixed address.

Case reference: 2021023948.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2021, David Anthony Gale was seen for the last time at the Independent Grocer in Athabasca, Alberta. David has not been seen or heard from since and police are seeking the public's assistance for any information regarding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006397.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2014, Joshua Jeffs was reported missing in Revelstoke, British Columbia. On December 19, 2013, a vehicle driven by Joshua was located unoccupied at the entrance to a popular outdoor recreation area known as "12 Mile", south of Revelstoke, British Columbia. Joshua has not been seen or heard from since.

Pants: Black, Trackpants with white stripes along the sides
Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, Sweatshirt, Hooded Sweatshirt with white writing
Grey, T-Shirt, T-shirt worn underneath SPURS Jersey
White, Jersey, Spurs white basketball jersey with #9 on the front
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Text “4LIFE”, back of right arm
Left Upper Arm, Text “DEUCE”, back of left arm
Left Forearm, Text “NORTH SIDE MOB MASK FACE”

Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014004557.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1992, at approximately 8:30am, Oscar Casaseca was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. Oscar’s wife had seen him before she returned to work, and when she returned home he was gone.

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau and Sainte-Catherine East in Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2014005157.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2008, Heinz Meyer was seen for the last time in Haines Junction located in the Yukon. His vehicle was later found on Marshall Creek Road in Haines Junction.

Jacket: Cloth, Dark Green, Light Green, Camouflage

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2020008397.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1981, Brian Orr was last seen by his parents in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Brian’s parents believe that he was in financial troubles.

Scar: Lower Left Back, 3 inches in length and half an inch wide
Right Eye, From nose to cheek bone on right eyelid

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India and was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2012020659.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2012, at approximately 1:30 a.m., Brandy Wesadquate was seen for the last time leaving a house party in the 900 block of Rae Street in Regina, Saskatchewan. Since then, Brandy has not had any contact with her family or friends.

Jacket: White, Black, Zippered; Adidas brand, blue or black stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2012020086.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1993, Willard Brass was last seen in Yorkton, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Willard led a high-risk lifestyle.

Hat: Black, Red, ball cap, crest of sunsets, with horse and rider, "Black Hills South Dakota" in writing
Tattoo: Left Hand, Love (text) and 4 aces across the fingers
Right Forearm, Dagger and a heart
Left Forearm, Born to be wild 1962 (text)

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004752.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2005 a man attended the Victoria Police Department and reported not seeing Belinda Cameron for over one month.  He told police Belinda had mentioned wanting to visit relatives in Vancouver and Manitoba but did not provide names to police.  This man reported sharing an intimate relationship with Belinda outside of his own marriage.  He said she was not a habitual runaway.  This man denied harming Belinda and through a Polygraph examination was determined to be honest.  The Victoria Police investigated Belinda's disappearance and determined that Belinda suffered from a mental illness, had a drug addiction and may have been a sex trade worker.  The last confirmed sighting of Belinda was at Shoppers Drug Mart at 870 Esquimalt Rd.  She failed to attend thereafter to pick up her daily medication.

Hair: Black, Long, Separated in the middle

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William Morgan was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, he was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of William.

Case reference: 2018063709.CaseDesc: On January 9, 1966, Jean Gott was last seen in Thunder Bay Ontario. Jean's daughter recalls receiving a letter from her in the 1960s and it had a return address of Gheen, Minnesota.

Dress: Cotton, Blue, White, Navy and white cotton dress with white nylon trim
Jacket: Wool, Grey, Grey wool tweed coat with a fur fabric collar
Skirt: Cotton, Orange, Beige cotton skirt with green and blue flowers
Underwear: Cotton, Black, Black cotton and lace bra
Scar: Left Knee, 1" by 1 1-2" scar on left knee
Right Knee, 2"by 2" scar on right knee

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine, Quebec was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005026.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2007, Eric Cox was seen for the last time when he boarded the Marine Atlantic Ferry in North Sydney, Nova Scotia heading to Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014006229.CaseDesc: In 1981, Cyril Thistle was seen for the last time when he was out on day parole and visiting his sister.  There is reason to believe that Mr. Thistle lived a transient lifestyle as he was known in Toronto, Ontario and on the west coast of Canada.

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2014005971.CaseDesc: Mrs. Guifeng Tong was last seen on video surveillance at her apartment on January 16, 2013 at 0958hrs. She was known to frequent Crystal Mall, Lougheed Mall and Metrotown Mall. She also likes to pick mushrooms at numerous parks in the lower mainland.

Case reference: 2014002473.CaseDesc: On July 4, 1991, Gabriel Bukredji was seen for the last time in the Saint-Leonard district of Montreal, Quebec. Gabriel was despondent and had also mentioned he was interested in purchasing property in another country.

Sweater: Pink, Blue circle on the back.

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2024035450.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2024, the body of this unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River in the United States.

Hair: Black, Bald, Short, Short facial hair, black and grey

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014001572.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1970, Arthur Stephens left his home in Gimli, Manitoba. He had planned to go fishing in the Whiteshell Provincial Park. Arthur told his wife that he would return on July 21, 1970. He further advised her that if he was going to stay any longer, he would call her to let her know. By July 22, 1970, Arthur had not returned home and his wife hadn't received a phone call. She reported him missing to police that day. On August 1, 1970, Arthur's vehicle was located near Falcon Beach.  Extensive ground, lake and air searches were done of the area. All efforts to locate him failed to uncover any further leads. Arthur Stephens whereabouts remain unknown.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Circular tattoo (exact design/pattern unknown)

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2022018377.CaseDesc: Devon Sinclair Marsman was last seen on February 24, 2022 in Spryfield, Nova Scotia.  Devon's footprints of life ceased on the day he was last seen and he has not been in contact with family or friends since then. Investigators indicate that foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014002842.CaseDesc: On August 17, 1971, Stella St. Arnault was seen for the last time as she ran into a treed area in John D’or Prairie Reserve in Alberta. Prior to her disappearance, Stella had had an argument with a family member.

Case reference: 2012020031.CaseDesc: Michael Feist's fully operational car was found abandoned near Cherhill, Alberta.  Mr. Feist is known to have well-developed survival skills. Police investigations regarding Mr. Feist's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2014004748.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2006, Diana “Daya” Gregory was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. On that day, Diana had planned to visit her sister, but did not show up. She is known to use the Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) when she travelled within the city, and resided in the downtown core.

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2020009588.CaseDesc: On February 8, 1989, at approximately 7:30am, Soekarmia Sarbirja was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Soekarmia was to attend an immigration hearing on February 10, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2014005064.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1983, Roy Nippi was last seen on the Chagoness/Kinistin First Nation near Tisdale, Saskatchewan. Roy was known to travel throughout western Canada and the western USA, however, searches and inquiries over the years with contacts in those provinces and states have failed to reveal any trace of Roy.

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2018000902.CaseDesc: Daniel Harvey was seen for the last time on December 28, 2017 in the Bellerive district of Montreal, Quebec. None of Daniel's personal items were missing from his apartment.

Case reference: 2014005230.CaseDesc: On March 9, 2009, Daniel Moisan was last seen leaving a residence in Victoriaville to go to an acquaintance’s house. Daniel has not been seen since.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Orange, Brand: Harley Davidson

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2018029824.CaseDesc: Azizollah Nabizadeh was reported missing on April 30, 2018, by his mother, who resides in Sweden. Azizollah had informed her that he was residing in Toronto, Ontario when last they spoke 7 years prior. The last evidence police could find of Azizollah in Canada dates back to 1995.

Scar: Mouth, Small scar below the mouth

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2014006767.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2014, Guo Ding was seen for the last time when he was discharged from the Mount Sinai Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2018054173.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2018, at approximately 11:00am, Melvin Hillier was last seen at his home in Torbay, Newfoundland.  Melvin had advised his family that he was going for a drive. Melvin’s blue Ford F-150 pick-up truck was later located abandoned on the MV Legionnaire (one of the ferries that operates between Portugal Cove-St. Phillips and Bell Island, Newfoundland). Surveillance footage of the ferry shows Melvin walking around the lounge area during 1:45pm crossing. He was last observed on video between 1:50pm and 1:57pm.

Case reference: 2014005412.CaseDesc: On March 2, 2010, Ian Murray was seen for the last time as he left the Mental Health Unit at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia. During the time of his disappearance, Ian was suffering from schizophrenia and had stopped taking his medication.

Case reference: 2022058884.CaseDesc:
Donna Williams was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on November 18, 2022 at the Women's Shelter. Donna lives a high risk lifestyle, is transient and has been known to travel between Alberta and British Columbia. 
Donna is also known to use false identification and provide false phone numbers and addresses to social care facilities and businesses.

Mark: Left Eye, Mole under left eye

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Persons head with feathers

Case reference: 2013000069.CaseDesc: Richard Riquier was last seen in Montreal on April 17, 1973. He might be in a religious cult in the United States or in India.

Case reference: 2020035556.CaseDesc: On the night of August 31, 2020, Cory Westcott was seen for the last time in Bonnington, located approximately 10 minutes outside of Nelson, British Columbia. Cory was reported missing to the Nelson Police Department on September 4, 2020.

Teeth: Gold crown on upper front left tooth
Backpack: Other, Multi-coloured side bag, Supreme brand
Tattoo: Neck, Unknown tattoo across front of neck

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake. It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded. The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2020010931.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1987, at approximately 10:20am, Farad Khan was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Farad had left his home following an argument with his wife.

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023013234.CaseDesc: Jake Corbiere was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2023, in Sault. Ste. Marie, Ontario. He left his home with an unknown male, advising that he was going to the nearby Tim Hortons.  Jake is known to lead a high-risk lifestyle and it is believed that he may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2022009281.CaseDesc: Heather Stoodley and her father moved out of their Burlington, Ontario home in October 2021 to live off-grid due to religious obligations. In the course of this process, they ceased utilizing social media and all other known technologies and cancelled their bank accounts. Her mother, who was worried that her daughter wouldn't be able to leave if she had a change of heart, reported her missing in March 2022. Heather’s whereabouts or ability to be reached has not been established.

Case reference: 2006009399.CaseDesc: Patrick Ukrainetz departed his mother's house in St. Isidore, Ontario which he did periodically, but always returned.  On December 26, 2001, Mr. Ukrainetz was captured on a video surveillance camera at a bank in St. Sauveur, in the Province of Quebec. There has not been any other activity on the bank account since that time and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back
Jewelry: Beads necklace and earing in right ear
Sweater: Blue, Sweatshirt with text or logo "St. Theresa Point"

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020003796.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 1, 1992, Ronald Bax was seen for the last time in Carcross, Yukon. That evening, Ronald last spoke with a friend on the telephone.

Mark: Neck, Mole on front left side of neck
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Pegasus, winged horse

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary, Alberta. Ronald has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2021050310.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of October 13, 2021, Cody Harper was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Cody has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.
